author: Rosemary Rossi, provided by
title: Carrie Fisher’s 1978 ‘SNL’ Episode Re-Airs Tonight
text:
Carrie Fisher’s 1978 ‘SNL’ Episode Re-Airs Tonight   
Carrie Fisher ‘s 1978 appearance as host of “Saturday Night Live” will re-air tonight at 10 p.m., the show announced on their Twitter account. 
The vintage episode originally aired on Nov. 18, 1978 with The Blue Brothers as the musical guest. 
Fisher died on Dec. 27 after going into cardiac distress on a flight from London to Los Angeles. She was 60. Tonight’s #SNLVintage at 10/9c: 
November 18, 1978 with host Carrie Fisher and musical guest The Blues Brothers 
– Saturday Night Live (@nbcsnl) January 14, 2017 
Fisher takes center stage for the “SNL” opening monologue, donned in full Princess Leia costume. “I felt a little awkward coming out here in my Princess Leia costume, because it might seem like I’m exploiting Star Wars. But I went along with it because if I came out as myself, who would recognize me,” she jokes. 
Here’s a little peek at what to expect:
